unnormalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Stiff as a Plank to Almost Flexible!
normalised: ## Yoga Practices: My Journey from Stiff as a Plank to Almost Flexible!

unnormalised: Okay, so I'm not exactly Gumby yet, but I've come a long way with my yoga practice. Growing up in Delhi, all I associated yoga with was the old uncle at the park contorting himself at 6:00 AM every morning. It looked terrifying!
normalised: Okay, so I'm not exactly Gumby yet, but I've come a long way with my yoga practice. Growing up in Delhi, all I associated yoga with was the old uncle at the park contorting himself at six zero zero A M every morning. It looked terrifying!

unnormalised: Fast forward to 2022, and my back was screaming from sitting at my WFH setup. That's when a friend, Priya, dragged me to a beginners' Hatha yoga class at the Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Dhanwantari Ashram in Kerala. Honestly, I felt ridiculous trying to do downward dog. My hamstrings were tighter than a drum!
normalised: Fast forward to two thousand and twenty two, and my back was screaming from sitting at my W F H setup. That's when a friend, Priya, dragged me to a beginners' Hatha yoga class at the Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Dhanwantari Ashram in Kerala. Honestly, I felt ridiculous trying to do downward dog. My hamstrings were tighter than a drum!

unnormalised: But something about the peaceful atmosphere and the instructor’s calm voice kept me going back. I started with just 2 classes a week, then added some pranayama (breathing exercises) at home after reading about it on 26/01/2023.
normalised: But something about the peaceful atmosphere and the instructor’s calm voice kept me going back. I started with just two classes a week, then added some pranayama (breathing exercises) at home after reading about it on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: Now, about a year later, I can actually touch my toes (mostly!), and my back pain is significantly reduced. I even managed a decent headstand (with a wall for support, of course) on Diwali last year! I still have a long way to go, but the consistent practice has made a huge difference. I even convinced my mom, who’s 65, to try it. She loves her gentle morning routine now. If I can do it, anyone can! What's your favorite yoga pose?
